AddImage(Recording, BinaryData)

Extension method on Recording.AddImage(BinaryData) Given an instance of a BinaryData holding an image the image is linked to segmentzero of the recording. If the recording does not have a segmentzero (i.e. a labelled segment with start and end offsets of zero) then one is created through the GetSegmentZero extension method.

GetDateTimeFromFilename(String, out DateTime)

parses the recording filename to see if it contains sequences that correspond to a date and/or time and if so returns those dates and times combined in a single dateTime parameter. returns true if valid dates/times are established and false otherwise.

GetSegmentZero(Recording, BatReferenceDBLinqDataContext)

gets a segment which has a start and end offset of 0 - this will be the dummy segment usedfor attaching images to a recording rather than a specific user selected segment. If there are no segment zeros, then a new one will be inserted into the database.

MergeBat(Bat, BatReferenceDBLinqDataContext)

Merges the bat. The supplied bat is either inserted into the database if it is not already there, or, if a bat with the same genus and species is present then the data in this bat is added to and merged with the data for the existing bat. Sort orders are taken from the new bat and duplicate tags or common names are removed, otherwise any tag or common name differing ins pelling or capitalization will be treated as a new item. Existing tags or common names which do not exist in the new bat will be removed. Notes from the new bat will replace notes in the existing bat. The bat 'name' will be updated to reflect the common name with the lowest sort index. Returns a suitable error message if the process failed, or an empty string if the process was successful;

Declaration
public static string MergeBat(Bat bat, BatReferenceDBLinqDataContext dataContext)
Parameters
Type Name Description
Bat bat

The bat.
BatReferenceDBLinqDataContext dataContext
Returns
Type Description
System.String
| Improve this Doc View Source
